habitat_description: Generally identified with forested landscapes including mature, large and tall trees of broad leaved, deciduous species. Species prefers an open understory. Can be found in wet bottomlands or in upland situations (Hamel 2000).  No apparent preference for tree species or group for nesting and foraging (Hamel 2000), although certain species or trees of certain crown classes may be used frequently in particular localities.  Gaps in canopies are important for species (Bent 1953). Minimum Tract size 1750 acres (Hamel 1992 & Hunter 1990). Generally avoids elevations above 3500 feet (Hunter 1990).  Canopy Cover between 65% and 85% (Robbins et al. 1989, TNC). M. Sanders 04jan10
